page.title: 06HENFIELD PARISH COUNCIL.
page.content: The Chairperson of Henfield Parish Council came to talk to us. She told us about her job. It is not easy looking after Henfield because it is a big village. In many places it would be considered a small town. The Parish Council looks after the general care of the village. On the Parish Council are doctors, teachers, professional people, the Vicar and some housewives. They are elected by the people of Henfield who are over 18. There are 11 meetings a year held once a month apart from August. There are sub-committees who meet regularly. There is the Cemetery Committee, the Museum Committee, the Lighting and Open Spaces Committee, the Planners Advisory Committee and the Finance and General Committee. The Chairperson said she spends about one day a week working on Parish matters.
